alert.note: Alert for Alaska Peninsula (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Wind Warning issued October 25 at 3:50AM AKDT until October 26 at 4:00PM AKDT by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM TO 4 PM AKDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Northwest winds 40 to 50 mph with gusts up to 85 mph expected. * WHERE...Alaska Peninsula, including Cold Bay. * WHEN...From 4 AM to 4 PM AKDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...High winds may move loose debris, damage property, and cause power outages. Travel will be difficult. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...An area of low pressure moves south across Southwest Alaska through Wednesday morning. Cold air advection on the western edge of the low will help enhance gusty northwesterly winds across the Alaska Peninsula. Additionally, winds out of the gaps and passes south of the Alaska Peninsula will see increased wind gusts into late Wednesday night.
info.instruction: People are urged to secure loose objects that could be blown around or damaged by the wind. Prepare for the possibility of widespread power outages. Use caution if you must drive.
